intro: Craterocapsa alfredica, commonly known as the Alfred's rock-cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
